overview_of_class: Labor economics studies how labor markets work. We will cover anti-poverty programs, the minimum wage, immigration, the returns to education, earnings inequality, and labor market discrimination among other topics.
name: Labor Economics
title: WCAS ECON 339-0-20 Labor Economics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Labor economics studies how labor markets work. We will cover anti-poverty programs, the minimum wage, immigration, the returns to education, earnings inequality, and labor market discrimination among other topics.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be based on problem sets, two midterm exams, and a final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Labor Economics by George J. Borjas, 7th edition. (ISBN: 978-0078021886)

subject: ECON
